speak;Kajal;Simon, I understand that you wish to destroy my lord's remains?
speak;Simon;Huh? Where'd you hear that from?
speak;Kajal;Don't try to lie. I heard you and the newcomer talking.
speak;Simon;Well, to be honest, that was originally the plan...
speak;Simon;Lord Morrissey hoped purging the swamp would help the land's monster problem.
speak;Kajal;I understand, but listen to me for a minute.
speak;Kajal;Vesner's miasma is certainly dangerous,{w}{br}and its lack of a strong vessel causes it to spill out and affect the land.
speak;Kajal;Perhaps destruction isn't the only way to resolve this problem, though.
speak;Kajal;If I, as a devoted disciple, reach the tomb and absorb Vesner's power...
speak;Kajal;I may serve as a faithful vessel, and you can rest easy knowing the land is safe.
speak;Simon;What will you do with all that power?
speak;Kajal;Continue to aid you.
speak;Kajal;As shocking as it may sound, I wish to see the noble houses endure.
speak;Kajal;While Vesner may have... failed in his attempt, I believe there is still a way to break fate's cruel cycle.
speak;Simon;I believe so too.
speak;Simon;So I will consider your request.
